text:
Hi everyone,
We started to receive to many HS internal errors calling HS API using python API client. Issue happens from time to time
```"(500)
Reason: Internal Server Error
HTTP response headers: HTTPHeaderDict({'Date': 'Mon, 07 Oct 2024 07:03:29 GMT', 'Content-Type': 'application/json;charset=utf-8', 'Content-Length': '100', 'Connection': 'keep-alive', 'CF-Ray': '8cec081c1fecdc9e-FRA', 'CF-Cache-Status': 'DYNAMIC', 'Strict-Transport-Security': 'max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains; preload', 'Vary': 'origin, Accept-Encoding', 'access-control-allow-credentials': 'false', 'x-content-type-options': 'nosniff', 'x-envoy-upstream-service-time': '3', 'x-evy-trace-listener': 'listener_https', 'x-evy-trace-route-configuration': 'listener_https/all', 'x-evy-trace-route-service-name': 'envoyset-translator', 'x-evy-trace-served-by-pod': 'fra04/hubapi-td/envoy-proxy-576fd69b8-d9pwp', 'x-evy-trace-virtual-host': 'all', 'x-HubSpot-correlation-id': '3d8aa32a-b5c7-49c3-858b-3bbb9b64aefe', 'x-request-id': '3d8aa32a-b5c7-49c3-858b-3bbb9b64aefe', 'Report-To': '{"endpoints":[{"url":"https:\\/\\/a.nel.cloudflare.com\\/report\\/v4?s=w965XYBrz2S6Nl9EjOvYuV8IQ6E6GZ4dEwpHsv%2BZMPKWPPFPgKUkZqUnPS%2BSvhkJY6yrpOqqfOW011PAxHAtrkjjdFZJlylQyWq3lblF8mV44BBlz%2B2ex53yJUxlzMqu"}],"group":"cf-nel","max_age":604800}', 'NEL': '{"success_fraction":0.01,"report_to":"cf-nel","max_age":604800}', 'Server': 'cloudflare'})
HTTP response body: {"status":"error","message":"internal error","correlationId":"3d8aa32a-b5c7-49c3-858b-3bbb9b64aefe"}
"```
Do you know what can be the rout cause of this issue?

Hi

I wanted to know that why are we experiencing a high number of connection denials when calling webhooks for task status change events? this was working fine before 2 days and all of sudden its giving error.
Just for info i am using Beta.

can anyone help on this please.

Hi all, looking for some advice as a non-dev. I have a client who has a custom-coded action in a workflow to convert a single-line text string into a date picker property. I’ve ran some tests in a test portal and the code works.

We now need to enrol 250,000+ companies into the workflow to run though the 1 custom coded action. Is there any concern or problem enrolling so many companies into a workflow at once with a custom-coded action?
Should I enrol in batches instead?

we are sending API via an external provider there tracks Open rates etc. They are already tracking the Email in HubSpot using the engagement API, however, is there any way for them to update the email Open and click into the native tracking in HubSpot?

Dear HubSpot Developers,
I am looking to understand if it’s possible to access what triggers bot-related notifications in HubSpot in order to filter out contacts created by forms that HubSpot suspect to be bot activity.
In a recent consultation with your customer suppport, I was informed that bot filtering can be triggered based on specific data such as the "UserAgent", the information about a known browser and OS used by the visitor when submitting the form.
Upon reviewing a similar case, he found that the filtering was caused by a flagged BotIP, as seen in the following backend details:
name:"filteredAnalyticsReasons",
value:"botIp"

Could you clarify if there is a way to access these bot filtering notifications, or similar indicators, to proactively filter out suspicious contacts?
Thank you for your assistance.
Vi
Hi Guys, can we edit smart content via the api? if so which one and how?

Reminder: *Want to be the first to know when a new API is available or an existing API has a new version?*  We publish all of that on our <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog|Developer Changelog>.  While we do our best to avoid <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/breaking-change-definition|breaking changes> to our APIs, sometimes for security, and reliability we have to. The Changelog is where we’ll post announcements ahead of time about it. <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog|Subscribe to the Developer Changelog> to stay up-to-date on what’s happening in the world of HubSpot development.

Hello All,
I want to fetch the contact object fields via an API call but I am getting more than 700 fields in the response, whereas I only want the ones which are not read only and are important while creating or updating a contact. Can anyone suggest any route param or query param which I can pass to make the response filtered.
Hi all - im trying to create a very basic calculated field with an API commend as the below:

{
  “name”: “icp_calc_minimal”,
  “label”: “ICP Calc Minimal”,
  “type”: “number”,
  “fieldType”: “calculated”,
  “groupName”: “contactinformation”,
  “formField”: true,
  “displayOrder”: 1,
  “calculationFormula”: “1"
}
i get in postman - 200 ok and i can see the field in HubSpot (i understand that i cant see the formula since its originated through the API) but the field is not calculating anything it shows ‘--’

Hi! I'm exploring the following Marketing API endpoints:
• Get all marketing emails for a HubSpot Account: GET <https://api.hubapi.com/marketing/v3/emails/>
• Get the details of a specific marketing email: GET <https://api.hubapi.com/marketing/v3/emails/{emailId}>
*I would like to be able to get the complete HTML output for a specific marketing email, but it doesn't look that's available. Am I understanding that correctly?* 

I can see the content of the email in the `content` property, but the HTML is split up within the `content.widgets` property as multiple modules. Each module has its' own properties (CSS, HTML etc).
• Is it possible to somehow get all of it as HTML, similar to what I can get when retrieving templates from the "Get the Template by ID" endpoint? I.e. GET <https://api.hubapi.com/content/api/v2/templates/:template_id>
    ◦ This endpoint returns a `source` property with the HTML for that whole template. I'd like to have something like that for marketing emails :slightly_smiling_face:

Hi, I am trying to update few contact properties with some values based on the CTA clicks for users visiting my HubSpot landing page. I tried to use the HubSpot API for this and it was successful when i tested using POSTMAN. If i do the same using a script in ,y landing page, it throws a CORS error.. Access to XMLHttpRequest at 'xxxxxx' from origin 'xxxxxx' has been blocked by CORS policy: Response to preflight request doesn't pass access control check: No 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin' header is present on the requested resource.  Has anybody overcome this issue? or any workaround?
Hi All, We are trying to export Deals data ( custom report data) via API in csv. not able to find all properties. how to find report field and its respective property in API?
Hi Kishan, any reason why you are building this internally vs using some off the shelf tool?
We want data to be fetched at certain frequency and it will be used for other analytical purpose. We are new at this and not sure about any tool.
Got it. You can try <https://www.superjoin.ai/integrations/HubSpot|Superjoin> to pull deals data on a scheduled frequency, and select fields which you want.
ok, I will check with Abhinav Das :smile:
Sure! You know him?
yes, we meet couple of times and in touch with him.
Awesome! Do try it out :slightly_smiling_face:
